page.title: 06POLING VILLAGE
page.content:
Poling is central for the Poling Hundred. In the Domesday Book this is called the Hundred of Rieberge or Risberg. The name Pollinges first appeared in 1166.
Poling today is a village situated south of the A27. It grew as part of Angmering, but did not exist as early as the last Domesday in 1085. In 1861 the population was 203 and now it is 180. Poling's name is typical of this area, being Saxon. It has an acreage of 923.
The main characteristics of the village are: nurseries, Perry Barn, Westlands copse and a small Post Office. There was an old scholl which was built in 1866. It is now used as a house.
